item.title: Solideon wants to decentralize rocket manufacturing through 3D printing
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Nearly five years after COVID-19 ground the world to a halt, the global supply chain still hasn’t fully recovered. Specialty industries like space travel were particularly hard hit, given the impossibility of heading down to the corner to pick up spare rocket parts. Industries began taking a long, hard look at 3D printing as a […]

item.title: Level Zero Health is working on a potentially life-changing device for hormone health
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
Level Zero Health’s co-founders Ula Rustamova and Irene Jia are swinging for the fences. They are attempting to invent a never-achieved technology that could help millions of people. If they succeed — and there are some positive early indicators — they will create a continuous hormone monitoring medical device. Such a device could do for […]

item.title: Nintendo tries again on mobile with a $10 Animal Crossing game arriving in December
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
It was a sad day when Nintendo announced that its free mobile game, Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp, would soon shut down. The app is ending its service on November 28; however, it’s also getting a revival. This time, though, it’ll be a paid game. On December 3, Nintendo is launching a paid version of the […]

item.title: SpiralWave’s pulsing plasma towers transform carbon dioxide into liquid fuel
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
If there’s anything that came from one of the worlds that was promised to us in “Back to the Future” or “The Jetsons” or innumerable other sci-fi franchises, it’s what SpiralWave co-founder and CEO Abed Bukhari showed me on a video call. Purple-tinged waves of white plasma rhythmically rose and vanished within a metal-screened column, […]

item.title: Wiz CEO explains why he turned down a $23 billion deal
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
Assaf Rappaport, the co-founder and CEO of cloud security startup Wiz, said that turning down a $23 billion offer from Google was “the toughest decision ever,” but justified it by saying the company can get even bigger and reach $100 billion because cloud security is the future.  “I think we did the right choice,” Rappaport […]

item.title: ForestGuard is building the ‘Internet of Trees’ to detect fires even earlier
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Many startups have taken aim at the problem of early wildfire detection and prevention, but Turkey-based ForestGuard’s space-based system could give it an edge over competitors. ForestGuard, which presented onstage today as part of the Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt, was founded by trained architects Muhammed Ali Örnek and Suat Batuhan Esirger, who witnessed the need for early […]

item.title: Wiz CEO says company was targeted with deepfake attack that used his voice
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Even cybersecurity companies aren’t safe from deepfake attacks. Speaking on stage at TechCrunch Disrupt in San Francisco, Wiz’s CEO and co-founder Assaf Rappaport, who recently turned down a $23 billion acquisition offer from Google, noted that his employees had been targeted by a deepfake attack just two weeks ago. “Dozens of my employees got a […]

item.title: How investors can help startups compete for lucrative government and defense contracts
item.dc:creator: Yashad Kulkarni
item.description:
Government and defense are relying more and more on commercial services, but startups face a real challenge entering this highly regulated and formal side of the industry. How can young, lean companies compete for contracts and attention with primes and more established organizations — and how can investors help? Watch as True Anomaly CEO & […]

item.title: NitroFix wants to use electricity to make ammonia without the pollution
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
Ammonia may conjure thoughts of off odors, but the world is entirely dependent on the smelly stuff as a fertilizer and for use in myriad other industries. Problem is, nearly all the ammonia produced today is heavily dependent on fossil fuels. Making the compound releases more than 450 million metric tons of carbon dioxide every […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A mysterious new image generation model has appeared
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
A mysterious new image generation model is beating models from Midjourney, Black Forest Labs, and OpenAI on the crowdsourced Artificial Analysis benchmark. The model, which goes by the name “red_panda,” is around 40 Elo points ahead of the next-best-ranking model, Black Forest Labs’ Flux1.1 Pro, on Artificial Analysis’ text-to-image leaderboard. Artificial Analysis uses Elo, a […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Apple Intelligence is coming to the EU in April 2025
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Remember when Apple blamed EU tech rules — and more specifically the Digital Markets Act — to justify the fact that Apple Intelligence wouldn’t be available in the European Union? Maybe that was just an attempt to turn EU users against their regulators as Apple Intelligence is coming to the EU in April 2025 along […]

item.title: Apple updates iMac with M4 Chip, 16GB RAM starting at $1,299
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Apple kicked off “Mac week” by unveiling a refresh to its perennial favorite all-in-one, the iMac. The big news here is the addition of the newish M4 chip, which the company says is 2x more powerful than the original M1 iMac. The new desktop notably arrives alongside the general availability of Apple Intelligence, which debuts […]

item.title: Apple Intelligence goes live with iOS 18.1 update
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Apple on Monday confirmed the general availability of iOS 18.1, iPadOS 18.1, and macOS Sequoia 15.1. The point update is most notable for its inclusion of the first batch of Apple Intelligence features, which the company announced at WWDC back in June. However, only select Apple devices are equipped to run the new generative AI […]

Join us for an engaging panel session where Ziad Asghar, SVP & GM, XR, Qualcomm, will explore the transformative potential of on-device AI and XR technologies in creating a unified and immersive experience across all your personal tech devices. item.description:
Fresh off a $1 billion funding round, Wiz has shot to fame as one of the fastest-growing, impactful cloud security startups ever. item.title: Rocket Lab Founder Peter Beck reveals his vision for the space industry’s future
item.dc:creator: Yashad Kulkarni
item.description:
As the founder and CEO of Rocket Lab, Peter Beck is a familiar face to anyone in the space industry. But the company’s ambitions go far beyond its popular Electron launch vehicle: Beck believes that to thrive, perhaps even to survive, space companies will have to become fully integrated one-stop shops. Hear Beck discuss Rocket […]

item.title: What you need to raise a Series A today, according to three VC partners
item.dc:creator: Yashad Kulkarni
item.description:
If you aren’t building the next foundation model AI company, raising a Series A today is likely harder than it has been in some time. So, to help founders building at the Seed-stage prepare for their first lettered-round, we’ve rounded up investors to explain what they – and their firms – are looking for in […]

item.title: Google expands AI Overviews in Search to more than 100 countries
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Google Search’s AI Overviews, which display a snapshot of information at the top of the results page, are beginning to roll out in more than 100 countries and territories, the company announced on Monday. Google first launched the feature in the United States in May before slowly rolling out to additional regions. Google says AI […]

item.title: Apple’s Magic Mouse, Keyboard, and TrackPad finally get USB-C
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Apple’s EU mandated transition from Lightning to USB-C has already affected most of its hardware. There have been a few stragglers, however. Near the top of the list are its desktop accessories, the Magic Mouse, Magic Keyboard, and Magic Trackpad. On Monday, the company finally addressed the issue. Along with an M4 refresh to the […]

item.title: Generative AI could cause 10 billion iPhones’ worth of e-waste per year by 2030
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
The immense and quickly advancing computing requirements of AI models could lead to the industry discarding the e-waste equivalent of more than 10 billion iPhones per year by 2030, researchers project. In a paper published in the journal Nature, researchers from Cambridge University and the Chinese Academy of Sciences take a shot at predicting just […]
